Doc: The FxSchedule may be expressed as explicit adjusted dates, or a parametric representation plus optional adjusted dates, or as an offset plus optional adusted dates.

Source.Contents:
/#
   The FxSchedule may be expressed as explicit adjusted dates, or a parametric representation plus optional adjusted dates, or as an offset plus optional adusted dates.
 #/
record FpML5.recordkeeping.FxSchedule {
  # Date adjustments applied to the schedule including the business day convention and the business centers.
  dateAdjustments : FpML5.recordkeeping.BusinessDayAdjustments?

  # List of schedule dates. These dates have been subject to adjustments based on the dateAdjustments structure.
  adjustedDate : date

  # Start of the schedule.
  startDate : date

  # End of the schedule.
  endDate : date

  # Defines the frequency at which calculation period end dates occur within the period schedule and their roll date convention.
  observationFrequency : FpML5.recordkeeping.ObservationFrequency

  # A day type classification, e.g. Business, Calendar, etc.
  dayType : string

  # A pointer style reference to a set of financial business centers defined elsewhere in the document. This set of business centers is used to determine whether a particular day is a business day or not.
  businessCentersReference : FpML5.recordkeeping.BusinessCentersReference

  businessCenters : FpML5.recordkeeping.BusinessCenters

  # The representation of the schedule as an offset relative to another schedule. For example, the settlement schedule may be relative to the expiry schedule by an FxForward offset.
  dateOffset : FpML5.recordkeeping.FxDateOffset

  id : string?

}

dateAdjustments.Doc: Date adjustments applied to the schedule including the business day convention and the business centers.
dateAdjustments.Name: dateAdjustments

adjustedDate.Doc: List of schedule dates. These dates have been subject to adjustments based on the dateAdjustments structure.
adjustedDate.Name: adjustedDate

observationFrequency.Doc: Defines the frequency at which calculation period end dates occur within the period schedule and their roll date convention.
observationFrequency.Name: observationFrequency

dayType.Doc: A day type classification, e.g. Business, Calendar, etc.
dayType.Name: dayType

businessCentersReference.Doc: A pointer style reference to a set of financial business centers defined elsewhere in the document. This set of business centers is used to determine whether a particular day is a business day or not.
businessCentersReference.Name: businessCentersReference

dateOffset.Doc: The representation of the schedule as an offset relative to another schedule. For example, the settlement schedule may be relative to the expiry schedule by an FxForward offset.
dateOffset.Name: dateOffset
